tif

Class TagValueConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.TagValueConverter

  • public final class TagValueConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for converting EntryIFD values to human-readable or numeric forms, using hint-aware transformation rules.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      Modifier Constructor Description
      private TagValueConverter()
      Default constructor is unsupported and will always throw an exception.

    • Method Detail

      • canConvertToInt

        public static boolean canConvertToInt(TifFieldType type)
        Checks if the given TifFieldType can be converted to a Java int (32-bit signed) without data loss or sign mis-interpretation.
        Parameters:
        type - the TIFF field type
        Returns:
        true if the conversion is safe and lossless, otherwise false explicitly for the types that cause loss of precision

      • getIntValue

        public static int getIntValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the integer value associated with the specified EntryIFD input.

        This method first checks that the entry contains a general numeric value (an instance of Number), and then verifies that the underlying TIFF field type, specifically BYTE, SHORT, or signed LONG can be safely converted to a Java 32-bit int without data loss or incorrect sign interpretation.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as an integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry's value is not numeric (i.e. ASCII or UNDEFINED) or if its TIFF type (i.e. unsigned LONG or RATIONAL) is not convertible to a Java 32-bit int safely and losslessly

      • getLongValue

        public static long getLongValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the long value associated with the specified EntryIFD input.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a long

      • getFloatValue

        public static float getFloatValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the float value associated with the specified EntryIFD input.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a float

      • getDoubleValue

        public static double getDoubleValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the double value associated with the specified EntryIFD input.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a double

      • getIntArrayValue

        public static int[] getIntArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the array of integer values associated with the specified EntryIFD.

        This method is used for TIFF types like SHORT_U, LONG_S, and BYTE_U where the entry count is greater than one.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the array
        Returns:
        the tag's value as an int array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain an int array

      • getShortArrayValue

        public static short[] getShortArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the array of short values associated with the specified EntryIFD.

        This method is used for TIFF type SHORT_S where the entry count is greater than one.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the array
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a short array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain a short array

      • getLongArrayValue

        public static long[] getLongArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the array of long values associated with the specified EntryIFD.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the array
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a long array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain a long array

      • getRationalArrayValue

        public static RationalNumber[] getRationalArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the array of RationalNumber objects associated with the specified EntryIFD.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the array
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a RationalNumber array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain a RationalNumber array

      • getByteArrayValue

        public static byte[] getByteArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns the array of raw byte values associated with the specified EntryIFD.

        This method is used for TIFF types BYTE_S and UNDEFINED where the entry count is greater than one.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the array
        Returns:
        the tag's value as a byte array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry does not contain a byte array

      • getDate

        public static java.util.Date getDate(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Returns a Date object if the tag is marked as a potential date entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object containing the date value to parse
        Returns:
        a Date object if present and valid
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry is not marked as a date hint, or its value cannot be parsed as a valid Date

      • toStringValue

        public static java.lang.String toStringValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Converts the value of an IFD entry into a string, applying any hint-based interpretation.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object
        Returns:
        the string representation of the entryâ€™s value

      • toNumericValue

        private static java.lang.Number toNumericValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry)
        Converts the value of an IFD entry into a numeric form.

        If the entry's data is a Number, it is returned directly. Otherwise, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException to signal that the entry does not contain a numeric value.

        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object
        Returns:
        the numeric value as a Number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the entry is not a valid numeric type

      • decodeStringValue

        private static java.lang.String decodeStringValue(Taggable tag,
                                                  java.lang.String data)

      • decodeIntArrayValue

        private static java.lang.String decodeIntArrayValue(DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD entry,
                                                    int[] ints)
        Decodes the specified array of integers and converts to a string value. This only take cares of decoding TIFF type TYPE_BYTE_U, TYPE_SHORT_U, TYPE_SHORT_S and TYPE_LONG_S.
        Parameters:
        entry - the EntryIFD object
        ints - the array of integers
        Returns:
        the string representation of the raw data

      • decodeByteArrayValue

        private static java.lang.String decodeByteArrayValue(Taggable tag,
                                                     byte[] bytes)

      • decodeUserCommentString

        private static java.lang.String decodeUserCommentString(byte[] data)
        Decodes the raw byte array of a field like EXIF_USER_COMMENT or GPS_PROCESSING_METHOD. These fields start with an 8-byte character set identifier, for example: ASCII\0\0\0 or UTF-8\0\0\0 followed by the encoded data.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array containing the 8-byte identifier and the data body
        Returns:
        the decoded, null-terminated, and trimmed string. Returns an empty string if the input is null, too short, or contains no data after the identifier
